title: Low-Complexity Coding Techniques for Cloud Radio Access Networks
abstract:
The problem of coding for the uplink and downlink of cloud radio access
networks (C-RAN's) with $K$ users and $L$ relays is considered. It is shown
that low-complexity coding schemes that achieve any point in the rate-fronthaul
region of joint coding and compression can be constructed starting from at most
$4(K+L)-2$ point-to-point codes designed for symmetric channels. This reduces
the seemingly hard task of constructing good codes for C-RAN's to the much
better understood task of finding good codes for single-user channels. To show
this result, an equivalence between the achievable rate-fronthaul regions of
joint coding and successive coding is established. Then, rate-splitting and
quantization-splitting techniques are used to show that the task of achieving a
rate-fronthaul point in the joint coding region can be simplified to that of
achieving a corner point in a higher-dimensional C-RAN problem. As a
by-product, some interesting properties of the rate-fronthaul region of joint
decoding for uplink C-RAN's are also derived.
